name: Kepler-27
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-27 Exoplanetary System


Overview

Kepler-27 is a star with 0.65 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.59 times its radius. It is located 3506.5031559999993 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-27 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the Kepler-27 system

Kepler-27 b

Kepler-27 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the Transit method. The mass of Kepler-27 b is 2895.31 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-27 b is 4 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-27 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system. At more than 50 Earth masses, Kepler-27 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


Kepler-27 c

Kepler-27 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the Transit method. The mass of Kepler-27 c is 4385.87 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-27 c is 4.9 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-27 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system. At more than 50 Earth masses, Kepler-27 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-27, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
